website_summaries.verdict: Columbia Redmond has its share of praises and criticisms. It is most loved for its breathability. Its lightness, out-of-the-box comfort, and decent support also never went unnoticed. However, despite the good points, there are also flaws found in this model. It is heavily criticized for its narrow width. The rounded heel and hard rubber toe guard are even met with a skeptical reception. In conclusion, the Redmond has features that potential buyers would find helpful on their hikes. That is, if the width can accommodate their feet well.
pros: A majority of owners raved about the breathability of the Columbia Redmond
A substantial number of consumers appreciated the lightness of this hiker
A lot of people were impressed by how comfortable they felt wearing this shoe
Many wearers greatly appreciated the broken-in feel of this gear
Many individuals found an everyday shoe in this offering from Columbia
Several people shared that they loved how well the shoe fits
The open mesh in the toe area was a welcome addition according to a few hikers since it gave them enough ventilation during summer or when hiking in warm conditions
The Redmond offered decent support according to a couple of owners
cons: Several buyers complained that the Columbia Redmond was a bit narrow
Even the wide option was still restrictive according to a couple of individuals
A handful of hikers complained about the low quality of this footgear
The visible mesh earned the ire of a few people because it makes them conscious of their socks
The rounded heel didn’t make them stable according to some people
A substantial number of people complained about the hard rubber toe guard

customer_reviews.title: Narrow toe box!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9 almost always, these felt too small and I should have gone a half a size up (but sadly I ordered them just before a trip where I needed them). The were light weight and I didn't have a problem with the lack of arch support others have mentioned. However, the narrow toe box was a real problem for me - and as the hike progressed it became more and more uncomfortable, especially on the downhills! I don't have a wide foot, perhaps a little wider than average, but I feel the narrow toe box is a design flaw for the standard foot. If I could, I would return them as they were very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: cathusa

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these but the tongue is way too big and sticks up too far. They are comfortable but the tongue design is hideous.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great out of the box, no breaking in needed
customer_reviews.text: Very stylish and comfy without the bulkiness that often comes with hiking shoes. I went half a size up and it fit pretty perfectly. I sprayed them with scotch guard as well and they kept pretty dry thru a rainy weekend. They lace easily and I wore them out of the box for three straight days of camping without any issues. If you prefer ankle socks like me, I’d definitely recommend wearing them with the type that have a lip on the back (like Nike Karrimore) because my Achilles started getting raw after a few hours of wearing them with regular ankle length socks. Otherwise they’re perfect and I plan on wearing them with future hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Comfy right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: + Pros Comfy right out of the box-seriously. They feel more like tennis shoes than hiking shoes. I ordered half a size up and they fit perfect with a little extra room for thick socks Not too stiff on the bottom-I imagine they will be perfect for climbing slippery wet rocks - Cons Not waterproof. There are little screen type things to let air flow but also would let water in. Shoe laces are slippery. Definitely need to double knot these babies to keep them tied.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes possibly saved my life in a hike down a steep rocky mountainside on my recent trip to Scotland. OK maybe that's overdramatic, but they gripped the mountainside perfectly on the downhill, and I felt very confident in them. They are lightweight and comfortable to wear, and don't take up any more room in the suitcase than a pair of sneakers. However, for me, they don't have as much arch support as I would like. Maybe with inserts...
customer_reviews.author: cln724

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: Seemed a bit thin or flimsy in the footbed. I tried them with my better footbed insoles and they felt a bit better, but overall the materials felt very thin and not because they were light, but rather that the materials seemed to be cost-cutting. I normally really like Columbia brand stuff, so I'm not sure if they're just trying to cast a wider net and get bigger market share, competing with lower-costing brands. Didn't seem like they'd last a full season of hiking to me.
customer_reviews.author: Yahtzee!

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I tried these shoes on in the store in the exact size, style and color before buying them so I knew what I was getting into. I took my first hike in them yesterday, and they were plenty comfortable. (I did also order some hideously ugly thick hiking socks to go with as well.) The big deal is the secure feeling when negotiating iffy terrain. I felt far more comfortable on my hike than I typically do in sneakers on this trail.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Hurts back of heels
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes to hiking and finally took them out of the box. I went on a 2 mile hike and my feet are killing me. The back of the shoes are stiff. The left shoe digs into my heel and makes walking unbearable. Not sure if I need to break into the shoes or not since it’s my first time wearing them but they were not comfortable out of the box of me. I’m glad I tried them out on a casual hike before I took them out camping or else I’d be having a bad time.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great, solid shoe, but no arch support
customer_reviews.text: Added in an orthotic insert and these are great. Got wet several times throughout the day but quickly dry, despite how sturdy they are. I was very impressed. the arch support is a small detail for me since, with my high arches, there are few shoes i can wear without adding extra support. Bonus: I didn't once roll my ankle wearing these - that's RARE for me in a shoe this low. They have great grip and grounded support.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Walking on concrete in bare feet
customer_reviews.text: I liked the actual shoe style and color and they fit descent, but where is the insole? A flimsy piece of whatever over the hard sole of the shoe. For a trail shoe I expect some arch support and a little cushioning. For the price of the shoe I expect to not have to go out and buy inserts. Like walking on concrete in bare feet...
customer_reviews.author: Mountainmommapa

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for the price - order size up
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a good walking shoe and the arch and bend of the show was comfortable on day one but it does run small. I typically wear a women’s 11 or 11 1/2. I ordered the 12 and am very glad I did! The toe box is narrow for a hiking shoe. I’m fortunate to have a narrow foot.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McBride

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but do not keep feet dry
customer_reviews.text: True to size and comfortable right out of the box. The upper fabric is not water resistant at all. Walking through wet grass results in wet socks. The fabric wicks water across it, so a little bit of water soaks the top of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: They proved to be very comfortable, throughout the hike
customer_reviews.text: I wore the shoes on a 6 mi, very rocky, hike yesterday. They proved to be very comfortable, throughout the hike. The fit was great, and they look good on your foot. The only problem I had was the laces kept coming untied, so I had to double knot them, then problem solved .
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Using as Trail Running shoes
customer_reviews.text: This shoe makes a bigfoot look cute plus the narrow toe box makes it extremely maneuverable. To run in I took the insoles out of some old North Face shoes and put them in these. Perfect, I feel secure on rolly gravel and bad knee liked not having the big clunky feeling of running shoes. I might get another pair just for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R McKinnon

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, very little arch support
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Fits well. I was able to break them in pretty quickly. However, the lack of arch support is a drawback as the shoe isn’t quite high enough to accommodate a heel insert.
customer_reviews.author: Viridian

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fit true to size . It’s a bit hard and needs some brake in time . Not completely waterproof, it’s more of a water repellent. I walk dogs in the morning while grass is still wet and after 10-15 minutes my socks get wet , but less then that is ok . Soil somewhat hard but other then that it’s ok shoe .
customer_reviews.author: Tatyana

customer_reviews.title: I like the look and the feel of the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I went to the local sporting goods store and I actually tried them on with my hiking socks to see what size I needed. I like the look and the feel of the shoe, but not the price at the store. I went on Amazon and bought them for a significant savings, received them two days later. They fit exactly as expected. They are quite comfortable. I took a three mile hike in them without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Design allows dirt to collect inside shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is great at allowing air to circulate around the foot. Unfortunately, it is a little too good and the material over the toe area allows dirt to enter the shoe and collect around the foot. I have had to stop several times on hikes to empty the shoe and shake out my socks. This issue has become a painful problem on particularly long hikes and I have stopped using them as hiking shoes. They are comfortable shoes...just not ideal for hiking,
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 size small for me
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe but it was a little short. I usually wear an 11 and this felt just shy of that. If there were an 11.5 I would try it. But they don’t have it.
customer_reviews.author: lovebucket

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and look good
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 8-8 1/2. I tried these on in a store that had my color and size, but Amazon had a way better price, so I purchased an 8 1/2 online. The are very comfortable and got me through a trip that took us from gardens, to nature trails to downtown shopping. It was a good investment!
customer_reviews.author: Socalgal428

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great fit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second pair of these after trying out my first purchase. They are a great value, and comfortable from the beginning. It would be nice to have a little more arch support, but it certainly is adequate and the fit is as expected. I walk/hike about 6 miles a day and these have been great all around shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R

customer_reviews.title: decent shoe, tighter than expected
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews I went for a 10.5 not an 11, I own shoes in both sizes (even from Columbia). These are slightly more narrow with a more narrow toe box than any of my other Columbia sport shoes. Otherwise they seem a decent lightweight, low-profile shoe
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Too small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my wife and daughter. I was is Afghanistan when I bought them and I just arrive to my country. Both of them are too small narrower than label. I bought both according to size chart and unfortunately both were not fit to ant of them. Return date already passed because of the my vacation time so is there anything to do ? I want t buy at least for my wife again. Could you please do me a discount for me , if you can ?
customer_reviews.author: özgür

customer_reviews.title: Great low top hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I purchased! The first pair lasted a year and I found them to be very comfortable after I added inserts for support. No break in period needed...comfy from the get go! I am an avid hiker and wore them almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No cushioning, flat footbed
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice looking, light weight shoe and the fit is as expected. I wanted to like and keep this shoe so bad but there is no cushioning and its not comfortable at all. Tried with the inserts and it was little better but it wouldn't be comfortable for long hikes.
customer_reviews.author: SueR

customer_reviews.title: OK for Short Hikes!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great but after 10 miles of hiking and running my feet felt like they were on fire. They are a little narrow in the front and my toes felt a bit cramped. Going downhill was not fun at all. I'm going to use them for short hikes and I definitely do not recommend trail running with these.
customer_reviews.author: A.B

customer_reviews.title: Traction and love the style
customer_reviews.text: Traction is excellent for climbing. Buy a half size bigger. Excellent shoe wish they had more colors to pick from. Bouggt them for Israel tour sept 29 oct 12 cant wait. Sharp looking shoe love the looks quality and traction and price
customer_reviews.author: patricia l vos

customer_reviews.title: A+ Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes for all day wear. They are very light weight and have hard soles. They hold up well and are not hot on the feet. Great for hiking and walking. Best with ankle socks.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Days

customer_reviews.title: Order half size up
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look good and are very light, however, I wear a size 8.5 regular width. I ordered my normal size and my toe almost touches the end of the toe box. A 9 would probably fit better.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need a hiking boot--I needed a hiking tennis shoe. This perfectly describes this shoe! Went on a four mile hike on the first time out and my feet never hurt! I have wide feet so I was a little nervous, but it fit great. Totally worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: Kem Fisher

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Hiking in Az and bumming around Washington. My 11 yr old has found these shoes very comfortable and they seem to be holding up. Great fit and ready to wear out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Deal

customer_reviews.title: Decent Shoe - No Arch Support
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair of Columbia snow boots so I thought I'd give these a try! Now - they're nice to wear. My feet don't get too hot. My only gripe is that they haven't any arch support so I had to use some orthotics to make them comfortable enough for my arch. Also, you must order a 1/2 size up from what you normally wear. Other than that, good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Todes Engel

customer_reviews.title: Good for summer
customer_reviews.text: They are more like gym shoes than hiking boots. I used them while hiking in Alaska and frankly, i could feel every rock I stepped on. I would say they are made for walking or biking. Other than that, I like the style and comfort. They are excellent for summer.
customer_reviews.author: eva

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of shoe by Columbia. The shoes are comfortable and I like how they feel on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice summer shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are short for a size 12 but since they're going to be a summer hiker I can make them work with a thin sock. They could use a bit more arch support, but overall they are comfortable. A step above a walking shoe for easy hiking. I like the look of them!
customer_reviews.author: Lara Wilent

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The shoe looks good but doesn't offer the support needed for long walks like 6 or7 miles. I will have to purchase another pair of shoes for more support.
customer_reviews.author: marguerita guerra

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for hiking and I love them. They fit as expected and true to size. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: jax

customer_reviews.title: Nice but bulky.
customer_reviews.text: Nice but bulky. On heavier side, but if you don’t mind that, would be good outdoor shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Block

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for mountain bike or trail rides. Lots of grip and support for solid yet flexible movements a lightweight shoe that breathes for longer periods outdoors. Dries quickly as well. Materials and company are quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gordito Lindo Amor

customer_reviews.title: Good for winter
customer_reviews.text: Little narrow. But if you put in arch supports they are good shows. Nice winter shoes to get a little grip without any slipping
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I decided to give this shoe a try; espcially because they were so cheap compared to what the department store was selling them for. The product fits as expected and true to size, in my opinion. I am a size 10 and have boney, sorta wide but not feet. I'd recommend going up a 1/2 size or full size if you plan to wear these with thick hiking socks. I wore nike dry fit socks and they were a bit snug, but I was able to wear them all day with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Went hiking in both water and on trail-great fit and comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful (non waterproof) hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly comfortable! I wish it was also waterproof, the similar shoe in waterproof is tighter. Tho they look very similar, note these are not waterproof. However, the material does "breath." I wear size 7.5-8, ordered 8, and they fit great. I am very happy with this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great support and excellent traction
customer_reviews.text: I have very narrow feet that require high arch support. This shoe was a perfect fit. Great support and excellent traction.
customer_reviews.author: pdavis830

customer_reviews.title: HIghly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: GREAT SHOES!! However, you have to "break them in" because of the tab at the heel area. I wore footies with them and kept bending that piece back off of my heel and it seems to have cured the rubbing it was causing.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Foot support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have used these like 3x now and so far so good. Provide good support and are comfortable
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret! Stop looking and buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks to right a review. Went on a few hikes and I absolutely love these sneakers. You won't regret, they are so comfortable and great for long walks. Highly recommend, don't look any further.
customer_reviews.author: Customer#1

customer_reviews.title: I'm confused by that because I have wide feet and these fit me great. There's even room to insert my "superfeet" insoles
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have commented that these are too narrow. I'm confused by that because I have wide feet and these fit me great. There's even room to insert my "superfeet" insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy319

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Trail Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable trail shoe. Toes accommodate a little wider foot. Color is attractive. Pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mulligan Augustus

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe feels pretty good, just a tiny narrow in the toe box but my foot is broad in that area and that is the only reason I didn't say I could wear it all day. I feel that if I pull the strings tightly, I get better support. Also, I have a very high instep and its good with that. Its a very good looking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I just received these last week and wore them hiking already and they are amazing shoes! They are perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Carter

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Slips on my heels and I don't have a narrow foot. Very hard insole even when I replaced the manufacture ones. Thought I would just have to break them in but I don't think they will ever be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Would not repurchase
customer_reviews.text: These cut the backs of my heels so badly that I bled all over them meaning, I’m assuming, I can’t return them. I was wearing socks. I’m not sure exactly what the problem is, I guess just an extremely stiff back of the shoe. Very painful.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: okay shoe
customer_reviews.text: Would prefer a little more cushioning in the sole. Had to buy inserts otherwise couldn't go on long walks/hikes without my feet killing me.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes at half the price of big box store!
customer_reviews.text: Great price, fits true and well. My daughter loved them. Held up to 7 days of solid hiking. Half the price of the same model on a big box sporting goods store
customer_reviews.author: BeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Broke down quickly.
customer_reviews.text: 6 months and they have holes in the top of both shoes. Big holes. They worked great for about 3 months then they started to break down. Now they are my farm shoes.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I got them when I started doing more hiking and trails last summer. They are breathable and are so comfortable. I have two pairs- an indoor pair for exercise and an outdoor pair.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and a good looking pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and a good looking pair of shoes. I bought them for walking/hiking when it's too hot for boots. I have only owned them for a few days but love them!
customer_reviews.author: Julie W.

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend these as a trail shoe at
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from Columbia. There is no support in these shoes and they run small so there really isn't much room to replace the insert. I'm going to use these as river shoes this summer. I would not recommend these as a trail shoe at all
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: felt comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations. Hiked 15 miles within first 3 days of owning them. No problems, no blisters, felt comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: I really love the style of these shoes- they are not bulky ...
customer_reviews.text: I really love the style of these shoes- they are not bulky (even in my size- 10.5!) and unfeminine like some I tried on in a store. Unfortunately as other reviewers have said they are stiff and not too comfy. Wah! There isn't a whole lot of arch support, but even so I think they will work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mittmom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: There are very good shoes for light trail running. They have good traction and are not at all heavy. They are not heavily cushioned, however they are still comfortable for rigorous wear. I have two pairs of these in active rotation right now, as I like them so much.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Run small, but very attractive.
customer_reviews.text: Am returning, very disappointed because I ordered 1/2 to 1 size longer and they are still short. They are very light weight and look great, wish I could keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Ellenoor

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for trip abroad. Have been 'breaking them in' for a couple of weeks, but it doesn't seem necessary. Good base, nice tread.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! Hiked the mountains around Bar Harbor, Maine and they were very comfortable. Good grip and the material allowed your foot to breathe. No blisters! Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: like some shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second air of this shoe. It fit perfectly and did not need breaking in, like some shoes. This shoe feels like it is your favorite pair of worn-in comfortable shoes, (part of your foot) right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Demedici1

customer_reviews.title: My favorite farm shoe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my farm...my feet stay dry and helps with stability on uneven terrain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Use for walking in woods, fields, streets. I generally love Columbia shoes, etc. but the construction of right shoe was faulty. I think the toe area was damaged somehow. It hurt.
customer_reviews.author: marjorie

customer_reviews.title: The shoe overall seemed nice but it ran to narrow for me and I ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe overall seemed nice but it ran to narrow for me and I had to return them. I didn't try a larger size as the sizing issue was only with the width and not the length. Shame, Columbia makes great products.
customer_reviews.author: Nicanne

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair like them before that I loved and these are exactly the same!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fit  better than expected
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this... so many compliments and very comfortable! Its perfect
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for Outdoor Walking
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They are comfortable and have been perfect for my outdoor walking. My only issue with them is I had to replace the laces because they wouldn't stay tied. Otherwise a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: April Laue

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are very light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I did not put my inserts in the first day and I walked 7 miles. Two days later blood blister. Follow Drs instructions. Learned my lesson. The shoes are very light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Ohl

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.text: Love my shoes. Had a pair previously and wore them out, so I decided to get another pair just like them. I do lots of counting steps and treadmill. So comfortable! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: sharon k meyer

customer_reviews.title: love those trail shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: love the fit--the security of the no slip sole--like the look and the feel of the shoe overall good for wlking my very energetic dog!!!
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoes and they're super cute on her
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the wife. Very nice shoes and they're super cute on her.
customer_reviews.author: John Chambers

customer_reviews.title: These run small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my daughter and they ended up being to small for her. They are nice a light weight with reasonably good tread, but not as much support as I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and flexible with the right amount of sole stiffness
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sabbagh

customer_reviews.title: No padding for feet
customer_reviews.text: No foot padding in this shoe! If you have any trouble with tender feet, find another shoe.
customer_reviews.author: PattyCat

customer_reviews.title: did not find comfortable and were too loose in some spots and too ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned, did not find comfortable and were too loose in some spots and too snug in others.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. L.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Don’t have any support ... it’s a simple walk shoes.. if you need support for hard days get Salomons
customer_reviews.author: Sol

customer_reviews.title: buy innersoles
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking shoes. They are true to size. But they are very uncomfortable. YOU MUST BUY GOOD INNERSOLES. The bottom of these things feel like conctete.
customer_reviews.author: jewels

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wore them hiking for the 1st time yesterday. So comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Talubas

customer_reviews.title: Too small in toe box.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could still return these. Wore them around the house twice, and they hurt my baby toes. Have never had a pair of shoes that did that. Also they are stiff and not comfortable on me.
customer_reviews.author: Katy W

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable, size was on point! I wear them all of the time with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Rheanna Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Dreadful! This is the most uncomfortable shoe that I have ever had in my feet. Absolutely no padding on the foot bed at all. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tallison1041

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits more like a narrow than a regular width. I have another pair of Columbia hiking boots that fit perfectly. Item was returned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: I have a thin foot so this is kind of big in the foot and heel area. that happens when you buy sight unseen!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great grip and fantastic support!
customer_reviews.text: Went hiking through a lot of different terrain in Colorado and these were a life saver!! Great grip and fantastic support! I was able to enjoy my hike and not worry about my feet!
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe ever!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. These are the second identical pair I've bought, first pair lasted three years with intense daily use in an urban environment. Only brand / style I ever want to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: NAW

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My wife hates them. The soles are too thin and hurts her feet.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Velasquez Jr

customer_reviews.title: I like these trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: They look great. Comfortable shoe. The back is a little high and rubs on the back of my ankle if I wear a low sock. If I wear a higher sock these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't wear it for more than 1/2 hour
customer_reviews.text: So sad the front of the shoes is so narrow. It squeezed my toes and they'd start tingling and hurt after 1/2 hour. I thought it would stretch with time but no success. I gave it away.
customer_reviews.author: andrea almeida

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these shoes! They are a little small in the toe box, but manageable. I can't wait to try them in Colorado when I head to Rocky Mountain National Park.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Ordered half size larger than normal size (9), and ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered half size larger than normal size (9), and still too small. Otherwise seemed to be what I was looking fo. Buying shoes online rarely works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair. Comfortable right out of the box. Love to wear them in the summer because you can feel the air flow through them helping to keep your feet cool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this shoe. It has a narrow fit similar to a traditional tennis/running shoe and is not padded very well for it to be a good hiking shoe. I ended up returning the shoe and Amazon customer service was wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Feet look good in these
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for about 2 weeks. I really like the way they look on the foot--graceful curves instead of clunky like some shoes. Slightly less comfortable than New Balance for standing, but I have no complaints walking or running.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Demayo

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They are the perfect color and really comfortable. I've been looking for something I could use as a walking shoe that was good looking too and these were perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Diane R. Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These are so lightweight and durable without being super bulky. I am a true women's 5 and they fit perfectly. Kind of snug with a thick sock, but easy to break in.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Casillas

product_meta.title: Columbia Redmond, Women Low Rise Hiking
feature_bullets: Combination suede leather, mesh and webbing.
International products have separate terms, are sold from abroad and may differ from local products, including fit, age ratings, and language of product, labeling or instructions.
